CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1942, pg. 17, reads: "Bobo and Girl Sing 'The Fistic Blues' - Harry Bobo, sensational young Pittsburgh heavyweight, and his charming girlfriend, Beatrice Williams, are shown here singing their version of 'The Fistic Blues' after Bobo was denied his big opportunity this week to advance further in heavyweight ranks when his giant opponent, Abe Simon of New York, pulled what fight observers are calling a 'run-out' and refused to go through with his scheduled fight with the Pittsburgher next Monday night. Simon claimed illness, while his manager, Jimmy Johnston, laughed up his sleeve. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Boxer Harry Bobo and Beatrice Williams seated at piano
